comment: Grade is based off of 2 tests, 1 paper, attendance (in-class assignments). She offers extra credit. Extremely lecture heavy but she posts the powerpoint slides. She has funny memes--I appreciated them!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Ruble is a very nice lady and had a nice calm class. She does make you talk to other people unfortunately. I wish I could take my other history classes with her. It's a very big class so I was shocked that she knew my name. You will have reading assignments pretty much every day. You will have a midterm and final exam and a paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: The class is very lecture heavy, but her passion for what she is teaching makes it interesting and engaging. She is very accessible for office hours and offers extra credit. Everything you need to know for exams is on the powerpoints, however, the textbook is very useful for the one paper she assigns and to clarify things not clear in powerpoints.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The class was definitely not the easiest I have ever taken however, it is possible to do. The lectures were quite long and a bit boring but the tests were straight forward. There are only 3 main grades for this course, The midterm, a paper, and a final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I never leave reviews for professors but this one I had to. I usually make all A's but she is one of the toughest graders, not one A. Takes attendance, very lecture heavy, & incredibly boring/dense; you'll never want to come to class. She's new as a professor so that may be why. Only good quality I would say was she's passionate about the subject.

Dr. Ruble is a very sweet professor who will work with you. Her class is broken down into 4 grades: attendance, midterm, paper, and final, each being worth 25%. She is a very tough paper grader and grades you as if you were a historian BUT her class is doable. She is very passionate in what she lectures on however her lectures are pretty boring
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Attendance, Midterm, Paper, and a Final are all of the grades. She is very smart and will lecture for an hour at least, but it really is an easy class. Notes are not necessary, all I did was show up, sign my name on attendance, then listen to music or watch Netflix until she dismissed us and made a B in the class. She posts everything online.

I never knew what was actually going on in class. I studied before the tests and aced the midterm and final. There is also a paper, you have to put effort into it to get a good grade. Attendance and in class participation assignments are good grade boosters. She is a solid choice as a history professor: accessible, passionate, and understanding.

I honestly had no idea what was going on in this class. There were so few grades I felt like something was wrong. 1 paper, midterm, final, and a few in class assignments. I took notes for every class and only studied a day or 2 before the tests and got an A. Easy class, Ruble is a solid choice. Tests are straightforward, just read the notes/slides.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again
